Limits number of service appointments dealership can schedule

Treat every job like quick oil change

Book more work than shop can physically touch

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI must intelligently determine if caller is sales or service intent and route accordingly
unique_automotive_requirements.implementation: Natural language understanding to detect keywords (appointment, oil change, test drive, trade-in)

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI must be able to decode VINs and search dealership inventory
unique_automotive_requirements.integration: Most DMS have native inventory APIs
unique_automotive_requirements.importance: High - customers call asking about specific vehicles

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI needs to access customer service history to recommend maintenance
AI must handle Spanish and other languages prevalent in dealership markets
unique_automotive_requirements.importance: High - competitive advantage in diverse markets
unique_automotive_requirements.adoption: Most major platforms offer Spanish support

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI must comply with manufacturer branding, process, and reporting requirements
unique_automotive_requirements.examples: Ford, GM, BMW, Honda, Toyota, Mercedes have specific CSI requirements

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI must understand service bay capacity, technician skills, job duration
AI must capture trade-in details for appraisal team
unique_automotive_requirements.data_needed: Year, make, model, trim, mileage, condition

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI must capture credit info for F&I department without running afoul of regulations
unique_automotive_requirements.compliance: Fair Credit Reporting Act, Equal Credit Opportunity Act

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI should be aware of open recalls and proactively mention during service scheduling
unique_automotive_requirements.integration: NHTSA recall API, DMS recall module

unique_automotive_requirements.description: AI should check loaner availability and book during service scheduling
AI should check parts inventory before scheduling service
AI must differentiate between quick services (oil change) and major repairs
unique_automotive_requirements.implementation: Separate calendars for express and main shop

implementation_considerations.challenge: CDK and Reynolds charge high API integration fees (subject of antitrust lawsuit)
implementation_considerations.solution: Choose AI vendor with existing DMS partnerships

implementation_considerations.challenge: Dealerships handle sensitive customer financial and personal data
implementation_considerations.requirement: SOC 2 compliance, data encryption, GDPR/CCPA compliance
implementation_considerations.vendor_status: STELLA and BDC.AI are SOC 2 compliant

implementation_considerations.challenge: Sales and service staff may resist AI 'taking their jobs'
implementation_considerations.solution: Position AI as augmentation, not replacement. Free staff for complex interactions.
implementation_considerations.best_practice: Van Horn Automotive: specialized teams with clear training and processes

implementation_considerations.challenge: Dealerships need to monitor AI call quality for compliance and customer satisfaction
implementation_considerations.requirement: Call recording, analytics dashboard, supervisor override capability

implementation_considerations.challenge: AI must sound like dealership's brand, not generic robot

objections: Can it handle warranty vs. customer pay?
Does it work with our DMS?
Will customers want to talk to a human?
What if it books bad appointments?
